explainers.backup:
Don't forget this password! It is separate from your %{cloudPlatformName} password, and you should save it in a secure location.

You will need it in order to restore your wallet from the backup in the future.

swap.slippage_message: This is a small market, so you’re getting a bad price. Try a smaller trade!

swap_max_alert.title: Are you sure?
swap_max_alert.message:
You are about to swap all the %{inputCurrencyAddress} available in your wallet. If you want to swap back to %{inputCurrencyAddress}, you may not be able to afford the fee.

Would you like to auto adjust the balance to leave some %{inputCurrencyAddress}?

swap_max_insufficient_alert.title: Insufficient %{symbol}
swap_max_insufficient_alert.message: You have insufficient %{symbol} to cover the fees to swap the maximum amount.

save.access_to_photo_library_was_denied: Access to photo library was denied
save.your_permission_is_required: Your permission is required to save images to your device

icon_unlock.smol_text: You found Treasure! Because you hold a Smolverse NFT, you’ve unlocked a Custom Icon!
icon_unlock.optimism_text: To celebrate NFTs on Optimism, Rainbow and Optimism teamed up to drop a limited edition App Icon for the Optimistic Explorers like you!
icon_unlock.title:
You've unlocked
Rainbow 􀆄 %{partner}

output_disabled.text:
For %{network}, Rainbow can't prepare swaps based on the amount of %{outputToken} you'd like to receive. 

 Try entering the amount of %{inputToken} you’d like to swap instead.
output_disabled.title: Enter %{inputToken} Instead

available_networks.text: %{tokenSymbol} is available on %{networks}. To move %{tokenSymbol} between networks, use a Bridge like Hop.

arbitrum.text:
Arbitrum is a Layer 2 network that runs on top of Ethereum, enabling cheaper and faster transactions while still benefiting from the underlying security of Ethereum.

It bundles lots of transactions together in a "roll up" before sending them down to live permanently on Ethereum.
arbitrum.title: What's Arbitrum?

base_fee.text_prefix: The base fee is set by the Ethereum network and changes depending on how busy the network is.
base_fee.text_rising: Fees are rising right now! It’s best to use a higher max base fee to avoid a stuck transaction.
base_fee.text_stable: Network traffic is stable right now. Have fun!
base_fee.text_surging: Fees are unusually high right now! Unless your transaction is urgent, it’s best to wait for fees to drop.
base_fee.title: Current base fee

failed_walletconnect.text: Uh oh, something went wrong! The site may be experiencing a connection outage. Please try again later or contact the site’s team for more details.
failed_walletconnect.title: Connection failed

floor_price.text: A collection's floor price is the lowest asking price across all the items currently for sale in a collection.
floor_price.title: Collection floor price

gas.text:
This is the "gas fee" used by the %{networkName} blockchain to securely validate your transaction.

This fee varies depending on the complexity of your transaction and how busy the network is!
gas.title: %{networkName} network fee

max_base_fee.text:
This is the maximum base fee you’re willing to pay for this transaction.

Setting a higher max base fee prevents your transaction from getting stuck if fees rise.
max_base_fee.title: Max base fee

miner_tip.text:
The miner tip goes directly to the miner who confirms your transaction on the network.

A higher tip makes your transaction more likely to be confirmed quickly.
miner_tip.title: Miner tip

optimism.text:
Optimism is a Layer 2 network that runs on top of Ethereum, enabling cheaper and faster transactions while still benefiting from the underlying security of Ethereum.

It bundles lots of transactions together in a "roll up" before sending them down to live permanently on Ethereum.
optimism.title: What's Optimism?

polygon.text:
Polygon is a sidechain, a distinct network that runs alongside Ethereum and is compatible with it.

It allows for cheaper and faster transactions, but unlike Layer 2 networks, Polygon has its own security and consensus mechanisms that differ from Ethereum.
polygon.title: What's Polygon?

sending_to_contract.text:
The address you entered is for a smart contract.

Except for rare situations, you probably shouldn't do this. You could lose your assets or they might go to the wrong place.

Double check the address, verify it with the recipient, or contact support first.
sending_to_contract.title: Hold your horses!

verified.text:
Tokens with a verified badge mean they have appeared on at least 3 other outside token lists.

Always do your own research to ensure you are interacting with a token you trust.
verified.title: Verified Tokens

unverified.fragment1:
Rainbow surfaces as many tokens as possible, but anyone can create a token, or claim to represent a project with a fake contract. 

 Please review the
unverified.fragment3: and always do research to ensure that you interact with tokens you trust.
unverified.title: %{symbol} is Unverified

obtain_l2_asset.fragment1:
You'll need to get other tokens on %{networkName} to swap for %{networkName} %{tokenName}. 

 Bridging tokens to %{networkName} is easy using a bridge like Hop. Still curious?
obtain_l2_asset.title: No Tokens on %{networkName}

insufficient_liquidity.fragment1:
The exchanges don't have enough of the tokens you requested to complete this transaction. 

 Still curious?
insufficient_liquidity.title: Insufficient Liquidity

no_quote.title: No quote available
no_quote.text: We couldn’t find quotes for this swap. This could be because there isn’t enough liquidity to swap or problems with how the token is implemented.

rainbow_fee.text: Rainbow takes a %{feePercentage} fee from swaps. It’s part of what enables us to give you the best Ethereum experience possible.

swap_routing.text: By default, Rainbow chooses the cheapest route possible for your swap. If you prefer to specifically use either 0x or 1inch, you can do that too.
swap_routing.title: Swap Routing

still_curious.fragment3: about our approach to routing swaps.

wyre_degradation.text: Because of the ongoing Ethereum network upgrade known as "The Merge," our partners have temporarily paused crypto purchasing.
wyre_degradation.title:
It's happening 
The Merge is underway

still_curious.fragment1: This is a precautionary step to ensure accurate pricing and the safety of user funds. Still curious?

slippage.text:
Slippage occurs when the price of a swap changes during the time between you submitting your transaction and its confirmation. 

Setting a higher slippage tolerance increases the likelihood your swap will be successful, but may result in you getting a worse price.
slippage.title: Slippage

still_curious.fragment3: about slippage and how it affects swaps.

flashbots.text: Flashbots protects your transactions from frontrunning and sandwich attacks which might result in you getting a worse price or your transaction failing.
flashbots.title: Flashbots

still_curious.fragment3: about Flashbots and the protection it offers.

fedora.cannot_verify_bundle: Cannot verify the bundle! This might be a scam. Installation blocked.
fedora.this_will_override_bundle: This will override your bundle. Be careful. Are you a Rainbow employee?

reassurance.security: We work incredibly hard to make sure your funds are safe. This tool never touches your private keys, so that greatly reduces the surface area for attack. If you are familiar with programming, you can check out our code on GitHub.
reassurance.text_mobile: You need to use an Ethereum Wallet to access Balance Manager to view, send and exchange your Ether and Ethereum-based tokens.
reassurance.work: This is a web-based tool to help you manage the funds in your wallet. It does this by connecting to your wallet through its Application Programming Interface (API). Here are some important points about how we designed Balance Manager:

image_picker.message: This allows Rainbow to use your photos from your library
image_picker.title: Rainbow would like to access your photos
